title: Serif typeface to pair with Burbank?
content:
I’m working on the layout for a children’s book. The illustrations have a 1950’s animated feel (think Disney). I’ve decided on [Burbank](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105124200/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=565&subpage=viewfonts) from House Industries for the cover, etc., but need a legible serif (slab serif, perhaps?) for the body text.

Any suggestions??

 [‹ The Most Useful OpenType Ligatures](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105124200/http:/typophile.com/node/40338 "Go to previous forum topic") [Online Training for Professional Book Design? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105124200/http:/typophile.com/node/40433 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Nutmeg

comments.content: Good suggestions – Thanks for your help!

[IT Golden Type](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105124200/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=IT+Golden+Type&x=23&y=10) and [Linotype Conrad](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105124200/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Linotype+Conrad&x=0&y=0) too seemed like good options.
